Call Secretary of State John "Jay" Ashcroft and demand that he do his job and release the Missouri abortion ban referendum petition by July 18.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Thousands of Missourians (likely including you) have been working with us to take Missouri's extreme eight-week abortion ban to a vote of the people.

Missouri Secretary of State John "Jay" Ashcroft is blocking our efforts. His goal is to make our state the first in the union to make abortion illegal.

First, he rejected the referendum outright. Thanks to our legal work, the Western District Court of Appeals held that this is outside of his legal authority.

Regardless, Ashcroft continues to obstruct the people's vote. He is dragging his feet on releasing the referendum ballot language. Without that, we cannot gather signatures.

We are calling on him to provide language by July 18, leaving us 41 days to collect signatures.

Today, we ask that you call Secretary Ashcroft's office and demand that he release the referendum: 573-751-4936. Should he fail to do so, we will not let Missourians forget that he has taken the fate of the abortion ban away from the voters of Missouri.

Know this. With you by our side, we set a precedent. No secretary will be allowed to illegally intervene in the referendum process like Secretary Ashcroft did. We made history in court, and we can make more by taking this issue to a vote of the people.

No matter what happens with the referendum, we're not done.

The fight for reproductive rights does not rely on a single tool. We will see you in the streets, in the legislature, at the ballot box, and in the courtroom.

Sincerely,

Sara Baker
Legislative and Policy Director, ACLU of Missouri
